content.description: Climb face moves into shallow, slightly kicked back dihedral with good rock quality.  crux  2/3 way up.
content.protection: sparse pro. a few placements of 1 camalots around crux.  Probably best done on TR at least first.  Not much gear available near top.  TR anchor can be built with yellow, red aliens and similar sized pieces and can be hiked to from the back
content.location: Hike up hill 5-10 mins downstream from Bass camp. This route is good looking dihedral on backside of rock formation.  Can be seen while hiking uphill.  Approx 50 yards to the right of Jamfest 2.0 and Megs love and the party boat

content.description: A bit of a misnomer. No jamming involved.  Climb the easy dihedral and bust right to some slabby moves.  Rock is good underneath but is still exfoliating.  Belaying on toprope from above is recommended to avoid rockfall until the loose stuff is all pulled off.
content.protection: Sparsely available trad placements on some sections of suboptimal rock. Setting up a trad anchor in good crack at top and doing it on TR is recommended.  #2 and #3 camalot, green alien and some nuts for the anchor
content.location: hike up the trail that is downstream from camp. start near large block or hike slightly further up  to start in dihedral

climbs.name: Megs love and the party boat

content.description: Climb face left of dihedral (Jamfest 2.0).  Good crimps on slab.  Slightly harder than jamfest 2.0.  Some loose rocks around the top. helmets are probably a good idea
content.protection: minimal gear placements.  Recommended to TR and lower in because of potential rockfall.  Same anchor can be used for Jamfest 2.0 and Party boat.  Anchor can be built with #2 and #3 camalot and green alien.  Nuts optional.
content.location: 5-10 mins downstream of Bass camp beach

content.description: Small climbing area near Bass Camp on river right. A few short walls can be hiked up from behind and top rope set up with trad gear.  Careful, quite a bit of the rock is still loose and breakable.  Fun spot for a little cragging on a layover day
